title: Secrets of the Titanic: Explore incredible stories from the deep in our all-new interactive archive
text:

The RMS Titanic sank on its maiden voyage from Southampton to New York on 15 April 1912 in one of the deadliest maritime disasters in history.

A staggering 1,517 lost their lives in the tragedy which made headlines around the world - including in The Mirror.

Now a new TV show Titanic - Stories from the Deep , which airs Tuesdays 8pm on Yesterday - is re-opening the archives to examine some of the intriguing stories of those on board.

It examines a treasure trove of artefacts salvaged from the wreck, such as letters, books, postcards and clothing, and tells the haunting stories behind each one.

To mark the start of the new series, we've dived into The Mirror archives for a fascinating look at how the story was reported at the time, as well as unearthed a host of true stories about those on board - not all of whom survived that fateful voyage.

We've also discovered some little-known facts about the tragedy and worked out how much tickets for the doomed trip would have cost today - with some almost as high as £100,000!

Click below to explore our gripping new interactive experience - and tune in on to Yesterday on Tuesdays at 8pm to watch Stories from the Deep, or catch-up on UKTV Play .
description: Examine everything from salvaged artefacts to gripping survivor stories to mark the start of brand new TV show Titanic - Stories From The Deep
